article_title: UMass Law professor talks on future of same-sex marriage debate on Constitution Day

article_metadata.description:
DARTMOUTH — Personal autonomy and religious liberties will clash in the years ahead after the U.S. Supreme Court’s ruling this past summer that legalized same-sex marriage, a University of Massachusetts School of Law professor said Thursday.
“We’ll probably have cases deciding what are the boundaries of religious liberty,” professor Jeremiah Ho said after a panel discussion in UMass Dartmouth’s Claire T. Carney Library.
Much as the federal courts in recent
article_metadata.author: Brian Fraga
